articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations General Assembly will vote on Thursday on a draft resolution that demands an immediate, unconditional and permanent ceasefire in the war in Gaza after the United States vetoed a similar effort in the Security Council last week.
articles.title: United Nations to vote to demand immediate Gaza ceasefire over US, Israel opposition

articles.author: Brad Brooks, Phil Stewart, Idrees Ali, Dietrich Knauth
articles.description: Several U.S. cities braced for protests against President Donald Trump's sweeping immigration raids, as parts of the country's second largest city Los Angeles spent the night under curfew in an effort to quell five days of unrest.
articles.title: US cities brace for more protests as parts of Los Angeles placed under curfew

articles.author: Naw Han, Shoon Naing, Devjyot Ghoshal, Eleanor Whalley, Napat Wesshasartar
articles.description: The Chinese-backed UWSA is protecting new rare earth mines in eastern Myanmar, as Beijing moves to secure control of the minerals it is wielding as a bargaining chip in its trade war with Washington.
articles.title: Exclusive: China-backed militia secures control of new rare earth mines in Myanmar

articles.author: Ahmed Rasheed, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: The United States is preparing to evacuate its Iraqi embassy due to heightened security risks in the region, three U.S. and two Iraqi sources said on Wednesday while a U.S. official said military dependents could also leave Bahrain.
articles.title: US preparing to evacuate embassy in Iraq over security risks, sources say

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: The number of people displaced by war and persecution around the world climbed above 122 million this year due to a failure to resolve multi-year conflicts such as those in Sudan and Ukraine, the U.N. refugee agency said on Thursday, noting that funding to help the refugees has fallen to 2015 levels.
articles.title: Wars now displace over 122 million people as aid funding falls, UN says

articles.author: Kantaro Komiya, Nobuhiro Kubo
articles.description: Chinese fighter jets flew unusually close to Japanese military patrol planes over the weekend as two Chinese aircraft carriers operated in the Pacific Ocean for the first time, Japan's defence ministry said late on Wednesday.
articles.title: Chinese fighter jets flew unusually close to Japanese patrol planes

articles.author: Steve Holland, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: U.S. Special Envoy Steve Witkoff plans to meet Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi in Oman on Sunday and discuss Iran's response to a recent American proposal for a nuclear deal, a U.S. official said late on Wednesday.
articles.title: US envoy plans to meet Iran's foreign minister on Sunday, US official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German Defence Minister Boris Pistorius has arrived in Kyiv to discuss military support for Ukraine in its war with Russia, the DPA news agency reported on Thursday.
articles.title: German defence minister visits Ukraine for talks on weapons support

articles.author: Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Polls show Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu would lose if Israel held an election.
articles.title: Israel Knesset rejects vote on dissolving itself

articles.author: Doina Chiacu, Alistair Smout
articles.description: They offered little sign of a durable resolution to longstanding trade tensions.
articles.title: US-China trade deal is 'done,' Trump says
